text: you know what I can't believe I have
never made just a plain pound cake on
this show so today it's vanilla pound
cake perfect cake delicious with berries
whipped cream whatever you want it's a
great base for lots and lots of things
and then excellent kind of recipe to
have in your repertoire measure out 2
cups of flour and then you can start
mixing here I have 2 sticks of unsalted
butter one of the important things when
you're making a real pound cake is that
all your ingredients need to be room
temperature and you need to make sure
that you beat everything really well
along the way so you have two sticks of
butter that's a cup of butter and to
that you gradually add a cup of sugar
and then you want to make sure that that
beats really well and gets well well
create the only thing that's leavening
this cake is the air that's being beaten
into the mixture as you go along so you
want to make sure that you get plenty of
air in there when it goes into the oven
the air will expand and that's gonna
make her cake rise so beat really well
after each addition of egg
and straight down the sides of the bowl
once or twice for the most volume you
also want to make sure that all of your
ingredients are room-temperature mostly
that's your eggs in your butter that
might be kept in the refrigerator
after you add your final egg you can add
two teaspoons of pure vanilla extract if
you want if you can flavor this with
other extracts then add a half a
teaspoon of salt and then gradually add
your two cups of flour you're going to
want to turn the mixer on low so it
doesn't fly all over the place and then
just add your flour now at this point
you want to mix it just until the flour
combines and don't over mix it because
then it could get tough so with all that
butter in there it's not likely it's
going to get very tough you want to make
sure that your oven is preheating to 350
degrees at this point and have a
buttered and floured eight and a half by
four and a half inch loaf okay now you
can fill your pan scrape the batter into
your prepared pan and then smooth the
top with an offset spatula and this can
get right into 350 degree oven until a
toothpick inserted in the center comes
out clean that will take about an hour
you should check it though after about
40 minutes and if it's darkening a
little bit then you can cover it with a
little bit of foil just tent it lightly
serve your pound cake however you want I
want to serve mine with some delicious
berries so I've just tossed my berries
with a little bit of lemon juice and
some sugar just a pinch of salt this is
a nice cake perfect for slicing thick or
thin
just simple berries makes this pound
cake so easy to make so easy to eat
so good
